comments:
I200312162000. Help attempts to launch Mozilla on the Mac and fails.

Go to Help > Help contents

!MESSAGE Launching URL "http://127.0.0.1:6527/help/index.jsp" using browser program "mozilla 
%1" has failed.  Specify another browser in help preferences.

An old Eclipse 20031010 correctly launches the Safari browser.

Konrad: does it ring a bell? Related to Equinox migration?

Veronika, Andre: quick in if the help works for you.

For M5, there were code reorgs related to RCP, and changes to the code that 
selects the default browser, with no intentension to change the default 
browser on Mac.  I do not see anything wrong in the code after a quick look.

If you go to Help preferences, is the "Default Web Browser (Change in System 
Preferences)" listed as an available choice?
If yes, does it work if you select it instead of "Mozilla adapter"?

Starting Eclipse with no workspace:

On the Mac: Preferences > Help defaults to Custom Browser (mozilla %1) instead 
of system preference.
The other platforms seem fine:
On Windows, the default is set to use the system preference
On Linux Motif, the default is Mozilla Adapter.

So maybe on the Mac, Help should default to System Preference since it is 
unlikely that Mozilla is installed on this platform.

And to clarify: after switching to system preference on the Mac, the help 
showed fine in Safari.
I see.  The default was never set correctly (to osascript) on Mac.  Will fix.

Fix released.  Christophe, please verify in the next build.
Thank you.

Yes, helps works fine, just the default is wrong.
The default was broken between M4 and M5.

The default might have been correct in the past by chance (order of extension 
points returned by core).
